repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: First volume of a 2-volume manuscript belonging to Édouard-Simon Ariel's (1818-1854) collection. It contains a total of 517 verb roots that are alphabetically organized into seven different booklets, each starting with an intertitle-page, indicating to their initial letter. Letters run from அ to ச.
The second volume is BnF Indien 161.
Description by Cristina MURU based on the Gallica images.
Original manuscript examined by Emmanuel FRANCIS, March 2025.

support.p: Different size and colours. As in manuscript BnF Indien 194 from the same author, different types of paper are found: (a) brownish and thick paper; (b) a light yellowish colour; (c) a darker yellowish colour paper. Two other types of paper are also found: (d) a light blue colour and (e) ruled paper. Examples of type (d) can be found at ff. 31, 38, 51, 56, 60, 75, 79, 126, 135, 161, 175, 192, 198, 217, 229, 253, 274, 312, 320, 329, 360, 367, 415, 430, 458, 499, 504, 505, 506, 529, 531, 532. Example of type (e) are found at ff. 204 and 377.

extent.measure: 1 + 532 + 1 (u1 + U1+ u2) ― 1 front guard leaf + 532 + 1 back guard leaf.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliation starts with the number 1 and it is regularly found on the upper right side of the recto. It goes from 1 to 532. In one instance there is another crossed-out number (395) next to the one representing the main foliation 170 (f170r).

handNote.desc: The handwriting by Edouard Ariel is difficult to read. There are many erasure marks. For some verb roots, a corresponding Sanskrit form written in Devanagari script is provided. Examples are found at ff. 11r, 17r, 22r, 35v, 44r, 50r, 110r, 112r, 125r, 136r, 137r, 142r, 146r-v, 147r, 151r, 164r, 301r, 326r, 354r, 435r, 436r, 439r, 441r, 442r, 443r, 445r, 447r, 448r, 449r, 450r, 467r, 468v, 477r, 481, 500, 501, 503, 525r, 528r.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker INDIEN 160 (front cover, verso).

There are two different stamps found at the beginning and at the end of each booklet. The first one is a red circle containing an eagle and the inscription BIBLIOTHEQUE IMPERIALE MSS.. This is the stamp in use from 1852 to 1870 (cf. stamp n. 36 in Josserand and Bruno 1960: 282). The second one is a red oval containing the writing DON n°. Examples of the combination of these two stamps can be found at ff. 2r, 105r, 159r, 226r, 262r, 295r, 434r. The number of donation is not specified, however the handwriting, as well as the paper used allow to identify it as a manuscript belonging to Ariel whose collection was transferred from the Société Asiatique to the BnF in 1866 (Berthier 2000: 61). In some other cases only the first stamp is found like at ff. 103v, 157v, 224v, 260v, 293v, 432v, 532v.
Two previous shelfmarks: 7481 in black pencil, crossed-out in red pencil and updated to 159 in red pencil (f[1]r).

Intertitles on their own page:
Radicaux tamils. அ . ஆ . (f1r). This booklet includes 101 verb roots.
Radicaux tamils. இ. ஈ . (f104r). A loop makes the long ī distinct from the short i. However, the modern form of long ī (ஈ) is used in the following pages (see. e.g. f152r). This booklet includes 52 verb roots.
Radicaux tamils. உ . ஊ . (f158r). This booklet includes 65 verb roots.
Radicaux tamils. எ . ஏ . ஐ . (f225r). This booklet includes 34 verb roots.
Radicaux tamils. ஒ . ஓ . ஔ . (f261r). This booklet includes 31 verb roots.
Radicaux tamils. க . (f294r). This booklet includes 137 verb roots.
Radicaux tamils. ச . (f433r). This booklet includes 98 verb roots.

binding.p: Hard paper covers, marbled on the outside.

origin.origDate: No internal date. Being a manusript by Ariel, the date of composition is based on his period of stay in Pondicherry where he arrived in 1844 as a French Marine Officer after having studied with Eugène Burnouf (1801-1852) in Paris (see James: 198-199).

acquisition.p: It entered the Bibliothèque Nationale with Ariel's collection in 1866 (see Berthier 2000: 61).
